flexbox.content:
# FlexBox
---

Flexbox is the newest standard which aims to help make it easier to build modern web interfaces with CSS. It's a spec that gives us ways to ["lay out, align and distribute space among items in a container"](https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/).

#### Learning Objective
---
Understand how to use the CSS flexbox set of properties as an alternative to floats.

#### Exercises
---

1. #### [Flex Direction](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_direction) | [LIVE mode](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_direction)
2. #### [Flex Wrap](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_wrap) | [LIVE mode](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_wrap)
3. #### [Flex Center](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_center) | [LIVE mode](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_center)
4. #### [ Flex Stretch ](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_stretch) | [LIVE mode](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD_flex_stretch)

#### Flex container
---

This is the parent of the items you want to flex.

#### Some properties
---

1. display
2. flex-direction
3. flex-wrap
4. justify-content
5. align-items
6. align-content

#### Flex items
---

These are the properties for the children

#### Some properties
---

1. order
2. flex-grow
3. flex-shrink
4. align-self

Also, clear, float and vertical align have no effect on flex'd items.

[More info here](https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/)
